dcterms:creator: R. Klinger
O. de Clercq
S. M. Mohammad
A. Balahur
dcterms:description: The WASSA 2018 shared task focuses on predicting implicit emotions in tweets, where emotion keywords have been removed, making the prediction challenging. The dataset contains around 188,000 tweets annotated with six emotion labels: anger, fear, disgust, joy, sad, and surprise.
dcterms:title: WASSA 2018 Emotion Corpus

dcterms:creator: C. Danescu-Niculescu-Mizil
L. Lee
dcterms:description: The Cornell Movie Corpus consists of around 300,000 utterances from 600 movies, with a subset of 58,000 lines manually annotated for emotions. It is used for evaluating emotion prediction models.
dcterms:title: Cornell Movie Corpus

dcterms:creator: S. M. Mohammad
dcterms:description: The VAD Lexicon provides reliable human ratings of valence, arousal, and dominance for 20,000 English words, which can be used to enhance emotion detection systems.
dcterms:title: VAD Lexicon

dcterms:creator: S.-Y. Chen
C.-C. Hsu
C.-C. Kuo
T.-H. Huang
L.-W. Ku
dcterms:description: Emotionlines is an emotion corpus of multi-party conversations, designed to facilitate emotion classification in dialogue contexts.
dcterms:title: Emotionlines
